masterFinding.verificationInstructions:
Verification Instructions

If any application functionality allows clients to set destination URLs / locations, attempt to connect to NetSPI network. If a request makes it to NetSPI, report insufficient egress filtering.

Alternatively, if any injection attacks can be exploited to initiate connections to NetSPI, attempt the same thing.

Reporting Requirements
  1. Show vulnerability that allows connections to external systems

  2. Show connection from the target system to NetSPI servers


Tools
  • Burp Collaborator - can be used to show access to external resources
masterFinding.remediationInstructions: Ensure that all network segments can communicate out of the network on only the ports and protocols justified by the business, and that all systems can communicate with only the destination IP addresses necessary. Also consider deploying Data Leak Prevention (DLP) technology close to your sensitive data to detect confidential data leaving your network. Ensure that DLP systems are properly tuned, and that the alerts from such a system reach the proper contacts in the organization to deal with internal security.
masterFinding.name: Weak Configuration - Insufficient Egress Filtering
masterFinding.businessImpact: Users and threat agents may be able connect out to the Internet to access unapproved websites, upload company data to the internet, and accept instructions from a command and control structure.
masterFinding.description: The egress filter allows outbound connections to the Internet over ports that may not be required for a defined business purpose.
